pr_title: #6098: Allowing to pass request headers from a spider parser to the spider task

timeline.message:
Allowing to add request headers from a spider parser incl. refactoring …

- Introduction of a new class 'SpiderResourceFound' storing resource
details used within SpiderParser, SpiderParserListener,
SpiderController, SpiderTask, and SpiderParserTestUtils
- Simplified canonicalization of visited resources (incl. supplied
headers) using one hash set
- Introduction of new unit tests in class
'SpiderParserAdditionalHeadersUnitTest' which create a custom test
spider parser + controller (incl. spider) and cover header-related
handling in the spider controller

Signed-off-by: Vladislav Dexheimer <vladislav.dexheimer@sap.com>

timeline.message:
Further adaptations for spider resource handling

- Removed "TODO" version references for logger
- SpiderParser now offers only a single notifyListenersResourceFound
method using SpiderResourceFound, other notification methods are
deprecated
- Added a builder for SpiderResourceFound instances used by the
SpiderController and SpiderParser (incl. SpiderHtmlFormParser)
- Removed validation routines from spider controller (now part of
builder)
- Replaced "depth" attribute of SpiderTask with the SpiderResourceFound
instance
- Minor adjustments in docs, logging, and comments

Signed-off-by: Vladislav Dexheimer <vladislav.dexheimer@sap.com>
